context: I failed to support your career aspirations
letter:
My Dearest [Wife’s Name],

I want to take a moment to express how truly sorry I am for not being the partner you needed as you pursued your career aspirations. I’ve come to realize that my lack of support has not only affected your journey but has also caused you frustration and disappointment. For that, I am deeply regretful.

You are incredibly talented and passionate about your work, and you deserve someone who champions your goals wholeheartedly. I recognize that I have fallen short in being that person, and I understand how important it is for you to feel encouraged and validated in your pursuits. I should have been more present, more engaged, and more supportive of what you wanted to achieve. 

I want you to know that I believe in you completely and admire the hard work and dedication you put into everything you do. Moving forward, I am committed to actively supporting you in every way I can. I want to be your biggest cheerleader and partner in this journey.

Please forgive me for my shortcomings and know that I am here for you now and always. Together, we can make this a time of growth and success in your career, and I will do everything possible to help you reach the goals you’ve set for yourself.

Thank you for your patience and understanding. I love you and am excited to see all the incredible things you will accomplish.

With all my love,

[Your Name]
